title: only on firefox can google meet not hear my micrphone. its been persisting for weeks and cant find solution. not the first time this has happened
content:
the past 4 producers have told me they cant hear me on google meet when i'm on firefox. it worked fine forever, then no one could hear me and i reported it a bunch and it got fixed. now the issue is back again and its been like for probably 4 weeks now.

zero issues on google meet when i try it on google chrome. Zero issues with zoom. its only when I'm on firefox's google videochat that people cant hear my microphone. feels like a repeat issue of what happened months ago when the issue wasnt with me. it was firefox. I've written to google, I've written to firefox. They've had me try a bunch of stuff and nothing is working. Can anyone help me???? Issue persisted before I went to macOS sequoia 15.0 and still persists with latest os. Firefox 130.0.1 (64-bit). I've bee trying to find a solution for this for weeks now:

-i've gone to "allow applications to access the microphone" that looks fine -i've done a new profile, didnt work -i've cleared the cache, didnt work -i've turned off ad blocker for that page, didnt work. -i disabled extensions on firefox, that didnt work.

please help!!!!!!!
creator: rachelcenter

title: Attachments
content: A problem began today and I can't figure out what the issue is. It is not a problem with my laptop, because I was in touch with Apple support. The problem is in Firefox, because I was able to attach files in Safari. I went to a website where I had to upload a file. The popup window had a button to click, Search for File (or something like that). When I clicked on it, my documents folder, the Macintosh HD folder, opened up but disappeared immediately. I saw it but it went away. I thought it was a problem with their website but when I tried to send the file to myself in gmail (using Firefox) so that I could upload the file from my phone, the same thing happened -- I couldn't attach anything to the email. The folder opened and then disappeared immediately. As I say, I called Apple, but when I tried the gmail attachment option in Safari, there was no problem. My Firefox says it's up to date. I closed Firefox and reopened it, but that didn't fix it. I also restarted my computer, but that didn't work either. If anyone has any insights, I'd appreciate it. I would hate to have to stop using Firefox and switch to Safari. Thanks.

title: Can't change default search results to English (Google search engine)
content:
Not long ago all my search results (Google is my default search engine) using Version 130.0.1 (64-bit) came up in English - as they should.

Then all of a sudden, all my search results came up in French. I never twerked with any of the settings to change it. When I type in the search bar all results are in French plus I get a pop-up window

Looking for results in English? Change to English Continuer en Français Paramètres de langue

When clicking to change to English I am taken to Google Search settings and am taken to page with Activity, Content, More options b Clicking under More Options the Google account settings I'm taken to the Google Account Home Settings page. Clicking on the Paramètres de langue (Language parameters) => Paramètres de recherche Langue et région (Language and region) I click on English. Works fine then .....bold text until next time I start up my PC.

Driving me insane %-(

title: Firefox keyboard behavious different from other apps on my Linux desktop
content:
Dear community,

I am on Linux Ubuntu and I have a US international keyboard layout which allows me to produce a lot of useful characters by combining two keys (' + e = é, ^ + e = ê, ...) . I had to fiddle with the system to get the behavior the combination ' + c = ç instead of ć. But it was working well. (https://superuser.com/questions/1075992/cedilla-under-c-%C3%A7-in-us-international-with-dead-keys-keyboard-layout-in-linu)

Since a recent update (I am on version 130.0) , Firefox changed its behaviour and now produces a ć instead of a ç. But this is the only application to do this, all the other ones are still producing the desired behaviour.

Can anyone understand why Firefox would not behave the same as other apps with the same keyboard layout selected?

Thanks in advance,

creator: kerryn11

title: Privacy still top priority?
content: I am a long time user of Firefox (I remember the Netscape days...) Recently, I have come across rumblings about Firefox privacy defaults. At first i dismissed it as the usual whinging, but then i started to see what appears to almost be forks of Firefox. I have already ditched Thunderbird because of their nonsensical thread defaults. Surely, Firefox with its privacy focus wouldn't be making privacy decisions from collaboration with other browser companies like google & Microsoft? One of the early really great privacy innovations was in containers, but it is still an extension. Why? Because of the architecture of Chrome, its is not possible to have containers in chrome engined browsers. So is that why Mozilla didn't progress containers? Did the money from Google for default search engine (shame on you Mozilla) come with strings attached? I came across Librewolf which mostly use the Firefox code but with much more stringent privacy defaults, and with bundled ad blocker as part of the default installation. How can it claim to be more privacy focused than Firefox when it uses Firefox code? Firefox is supposedly the privacy focus browser so why is it following what Chrome and Edge do? They will NEVER gain lost market share by watering down their privacy settings which is the reason to even exist. It just antagonizes users like me. Or is that the point, a nice easy progression till oblivion and we all then accept an advertisement riddled internet.
creator: bernie4

title: Firefox no syncing ( ?) and now tabs are crashing
content: ( I have used Firefox for 50% of my browsing for the past 14 Years) A couple of months ago I opened Firefox( today I checked for updates and I have version 130.01) and was surprised to find that there were no tabs on my home page. I noticed it was slower in searching either with urls or the search box on the screen. Today the tabs have started crashing, ironically on the second try after I use the restore tab button, it is loading pages faster than it has for some time. However when I tried the search 'business cards' it just kept repeat crashing. Maybe I should have dropped by earlier but I have other browsers, though I prefer Firefox and I was just trying to get a ton of stuff done. ( I went through the troubleshooting data, but this appears to be a user experience thing as the the last lot of data was from the 4th of September). Super annoying

title: Unable to allow access to a mcrophone and camera ever since the upgrade to Sequoia 15.0 on my MacBook Pro
content:
Good evening,

I was successfully using Mozilla Firefox version 115 to login to my work portal that I use as the interpreter. That means we are using audio/video option. My firewall is on and all the connection to and from Firefox are allowed, and were allowed all along, I did not have to allow it after the Bug 1919173 was identified for some users. I was able to use the Internet on Firefox, and I am using it right now logged on using Firefox browser. But the issue is now with the upgrade that the calls I am receiving are being disconnected whether it is the audio or video. Video freezes, and that never happened before the upgrade. According to my MacBook Pro Firewall, "all connections to Firewall allowed", I don't understand then I am being disconnected when all the permissions are granted to access the microphone and the camera whenever prompted. I looked at the Privacy and Security/Permissions/Microphone/Camera/Settings, in Firefox Settings/Preferences and the dialog box that opens after clicking on Settings, basically does not serve the purpose because there is no +sign to add the portal webpage name to "always allow access to Microphone and camera" despite the permissions were already allowed numerous times from Firefox prompts when the call/session started. I did not have the portal webpage added to this specific dialog box because it was not necessary, and frankly I never opened the permissions under Privacy and Security so I don't know if the + sign was enabled before the upgrade. I opened the firewall on my MAC and Firefox is one of the applications allowed with "All the communications to Firefox Allowed" with green dot right by it. I am afraid to delete it and then add it again Under my MacBook Pro Settings and the firewall because of possibility I would not be able to use the Firefox then, at all. Do you know if anybody tried it already and succeeded? I even tried to install newer Firefox version 130 but that one had sound issues with crackly and breaking up issues from the other end. I uninstalled Firefox version 130, and I am keeping this one, version 115 that I used successfully for VoIP for at least last six months. Is there any plan from developers to work on the dialog box under Privacy and Security/Permissions/Camera/Microphone/Settings and have the plus sign enabled to be able to add the portal web page I am using for my work? Are there any other suggestions or we just have to wait until Apple would work on the fix and issues the patch for this bug? Thank you so much.
creator: cmfxnwmvbj
